chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:33 AM 
Defendant Deric J. Curtis in court, in custody. 
Attorney Toni L. Young in court for Deric J. Curtis.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
22CF838 & 22CM812:
Victim rights compliance. 
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time to consider offer.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:40 PM Defendant Deric J. Curtis appeared with Attorney Toni L. Young.  Defendant in custody.   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE motion to modify bond to be heard before the trial court.   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br. 4.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Deric J. Curtis in court, in custody.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms.   No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Angelo H, Brandee W, KPD Officer R - except for in a professional capacity.

01:54 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Zachary Caley.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.. $ 1000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
